Description: The return from Egypt; the Holy Family walking along a track, Mary and Joseph wearing sandals, Christ barefoot and holding a staff; Joseph holds an axe; landscape of trees and hills. Mezzotint
Producer name: Attributed to: John Smith, the mezzotinter
Curator's comments: Ganz attributes this to Smith, noting that the features of the Christ Child are in his manner. The composition appears to be based on a painting by Rubens (Rooses 183) which was engraved by Schelte A. Bolswert (Hollstein 183; R,5.51). There is also an engraving by Cornelis Galle (II) which is closer to this, in that St Joseph carries a staff and bundle over his shoulder, rather than leaning on his staff (see 1891,0414.594).
Bibliographic references: Chaloner Smith 1883 / British Mezzotinto portraits from the introduction of the art to the early part of the present century (undescribed)
